reviews.review: Infinity War would claim to be the culmination of a decade of MCU films, yet in reality it's merely another setup for future installments, establishing a conflict that can only hope to be resolved by walking back nearly everything that happens in these two-and-a-half hours.
Thrilling, exciting, dramatic, brings all of the MCU to an amazing "ending" though, it has nearly begun.

Very good avengers movie. Im glad they chilled out on the humor. They learned their lesson from ragnorok. I think it was ballsy and very emotional the way it ended. Thanos was a really good villain. He had a good reason to kill everyone but ultimately it wasn't his call and thats why he is wrong. Dope movie and i cant wait to see the next one and see this one again.
Overrated. Not bad, but nothing new. Just a lot of CGI fight scenes over & over again. Characters died but didn't care because the movie didn't move me..

This movie was amazing. The acting, the story, and fight scenes were on point. The CGI was awesome minus a couple scenes. Thanos is the best villain in the Marvel Universe. 5 out 5 stars for this epic masterpiece. I understood exactly what Doctor Strange was doing. Canâ€™t wait for the next movie. Great work Marvel.

NO SPOILERS!

This is everything Marvel Studios has been building towards and they stuck the landing in every way possible.

The joy that comes from seeing all these franchises converge in one movie has never been felt before and the rollercoaster of a plot will keep you guessing and in awe the whole way thru.

Probably the greatest accomplishment of this film was evolving Thanos into an extremely complex character, one who from a certain viewpoint can be seen as sympathetic and noble. His actions are truly evil, but there's a logical conviction about him that is so endearing.

Obviously this is superhero pop at it's finest, but the weight of the events of the film as well as the interpersonal moments with the characters are what sets it firmly among Marvel's best.

The film isn't without minor details I wish were added, but the sum of it's parts as well as that ending are what earns it 5 stars for me.
I guess The MCU and GoT have more than I thought in common.... they both, now have their-own Red Wedding!

When I came out of the cinema, I was still wearing the awesomeness glasses but as I started scrutinising the movie more. The flaws became evident. The movie feels rushed and they got alot of the things wrong in it. Thanos is never humane. He doesn't cry and they made the Black Order look like some bunch of cheap villains whereas they are strong enough to take out the Avengers alone. The action was good in some parts but it feels rushed. It tries so hard to be a part one of a movie that it fails to live up being a good movie. Most of the characters are there just for the sake of being there when they don't serve any purpose. It established itself as a spectacle and a spectacle it was and yet when you walk out of the cinema, you feel extremely underwhelmed.
